headline: Slow Cooker Vegetarian Minestrone
description: This crockpot minestrone soup features beans, veggies, macaroni, and herbs that simmer all day in a rich, savory broth. Perfect for a warm dinner!

video.description: Easy, delicious and nutritious veggie soup!
video.name: Slow Cooker Vegetarian Minestrone

name: Slow Cooker Vegetarian Minestrone
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup finely grated Parmesan cheese, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine broth, tomatoes, kidney beans, onion, carrots, celery, green beans, zucchini, garlic, parsley, oregano, salt, thyme, and pepper in a 6-quart slow cooker. Cover and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until cooked through but firm to the bite, 8 minutes; drain.
Stir macaroni and spinach into the slow cooker; cover and cook for 15 more minutes. Ladle into bowls and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

review.reviewBody: I added a bit of left over chicken. This soup is delicious.

A very delicious recipe similar to Olive Garden. I added 2c more broth & a bit more of each spice except salt. I agree that the pasta soaks up too much broth and gets mushy, adding to each bowl (especially for leftovers) is a good idea. I made it in the instant pot putting everything in except pasta, spinach, and parm cheese on soup setting, NPR 10 min. Release pressure and add spinach (& pasta if not adding to each bowl) on top of soup manual high for 10 min, NPR 10 min

Love this recipe. The only thing I omitted was onions (make me sick as heck). Swapped out the kidney beans with cannellini beans, added extra potatoes (baby golds, skin on). I added 1 can of Italian green beans. When chopping up the celery I saved a bunch of the leaves and added them also. This soup is so good you won’t notice that it doesn’t have any meat in it! Works great in a crockpot on low for 6 hours, none of the veggies were mushy. Will be making it again next week, and will try adding some V8 vegetable juice!

This recipe was everything I could want in a Minestone soup and more. I did add some asparagus towards the end for a bit of crunch. My wife loved it. We had a couple of servings the first two days and froze the rest. It was just as good after thawing although we did add a bit of water. We will eat this again for sure.
The only change that I made was I used the small shell noodles instead of the elbow macaroni. This was amazing. very comparable to Olive Garden Minestrone soup. Will be making this again.
Great soup... we used Cayenne Pepper and citrus seasoning . We skipped the zucchini. We fried everything for 5 min before adding the veggie broth.

Alright, anyone giving this recipe negative reviews is a newb in the kitchen. There are things they don't tell you to do, that a fairly seasoned cook would just know. ie- like others said, simmer the onion and garlic in oil first, then add the rest of the ingredients. Here's a few changes i made, but you can really add whatever veggies you like to this and it will come out good. I just went the Campbell's vegetable soup route.

I took out the zucchini and celery and added fresh mushrooms (halved), canned green beans, (cut, not french) and canned corn. I also added more potatoes - about a handful of petite red (halfed) and I cut up 2 baking potatoes into pieces about the same size as the red potatoes. 
So, most people who have cooked a soup a few times would know this, but always add the veggies that are going to take longer, first. In my case, the potatoes and carrots. Also, I did NOT use a slow cooker, because all of this would have turned to mush. I also did not add pasta out of personal preference. Instead of 6 cups of broth, I used 8 - or two quarts of organic vegetable broth (boxed). Doubled the salt because my broth was low sodium. Add 1 bay leaf. I also cut the kidney beans in half since I had plenty of potatoes in there and didn't want it to have an extra starchy texture. When the carrots, potatoes, and kidney beans got to be about half-cooked (yes, you need to keep checking it about every 10-15 min) then it was time to add the canned vegetables (since they're technic

Didn't make any changes. My husband's "I'm pulling a fast one on my taste buds, they don't even know they are eating all these veggies." Our son's reply "I know, it confuses my eyes". Absolutely love this soup I make a double batch and freeze without pasta. Delicious!
I liked it, my 15 yr old didn't. I add an extra 1/2 head of cabbage since it was going bad.
I like but a little bland.

This soup is the bomb. this is the best minestrone soup I have made. and so simple to make in the slow cooker. one tip I will share is it is really good with some croutons in it when you go to eat it. Brings a really nice addition to the soup. Enjoy.

It smelled really good while cooking. But when we went to eat it... flavorless. I handed the leftovers over to my brother, the hobby chef, he added some red pepper flakes, roasted garlic, and quite a bit more salt and simmered it longer to let the new flavors infuse. That helped a lot.
I made this with the veggies and herbs I had on hand: onion, carrots, sweet potatoes, and fresh spinach. I didn't have parsley. Even with the changes, it was yummy.

I love homemade soups, and this recipe is a real winner. Instead of cooking in slow cooker, I simmered it on the stove top for 30 minutes until vegetables were tender then added spinach and macaroni. Excellent. It does not need the parmesan cheese - leave it off to save points on weight watchers.

I made this exactly like the recipe called for and my husband and parents loved it. My dad said it was the best Minestrone he's ever had, even from restaurants. I Will definitely make it again! (I used small pasta shells because that's what I had in the pantry.)
Delicious. Hearty and healthy. Great for a mid Winter supper. Followed recipe exactly as written. This is a keeper.
I pretty much made it as directed except on stovetop. Very hearty and delicious! I’ll definitely make it again.
So good! The macaroni did take some of the broth, but I like thicker soups so that worked.
Exceptional and full of body. You can taste the flavor of all the vegetables and the consistency was excellent. A hardy soup, better than any restaurant!
Good soup but I'd prefer a bit more intense flavor.

This recipe is easy and delicious. It fills the house with an enticing aroma which makes my family ask when it will be done. Satisfies meat-eaters and vegetarians alike. I usually split the recipe at the end to add cheese tortellini for those that prefer a bit more protein.

We loved it. I made a few changes, not much. I took the advice of others and cooked this on the stove top in my dutch oven, let it simmer about 1 1/2 hours. I omitted the zucchini and used butternut squash instead...tasty! We also added an extra 8oz can of tomato sauce to intensify the flavor. Next time I make it I will sauté the onions, garlic and maybe even the hard veggies first. I will definitely be made again!
I made it following the recipe and it came out delicious. I did use vegie pasta to cut down on the carbs.
This was good, and very easy. I made it exactly as written but I did add chick peas for more fiber.
I loved this recipe! Next time, I’m going to add stewed tomatoes and use shell pasta to change it up a bit more to my liking. Great overall!

Just made this. I loved it but for me, personally, I would have not added spinach. Love my greens just not in this. The recipe says crushed or diced tomatoes in a can but if you add all ingredients to your shopping list, your list has a can of whole plum tomatoes. I should have paid more attention I guess. All in all, very tasty.

This was an outstanding minestrone, right after it was done. The next day, the soup had lost some of its goodness.
I've got celiac disease, and thus had to use gluten free elbows. These elbows don't do well as leftovers. The next day, the elbows had become way too mushy. 
Nevertheless, I ate the leftovers. They were still pretty great.
Deeeeelicious!
Always loved Minestrone soup. Followed the recipe, but added extra veg that were hanging out in the frig and a bit of sriracha for some tang. My mom used to call it “clean refrigerator soup”.
I made it on the stovetop in less than an hour with chopping time. Delicious! One note, I only had chopped tomatoes instead of crushed and I do think it would’ve been better with crushed.
Used my dutch oven for this and included everything except celery, and parsley. I substituted the macaroni for potatoes. The smell is great, as well as, the taste.

Didn't love it as written. May tweak the seasonings a bit 
next time
Good throw together soup. Tastes great!

Made this in my Tupperware pressure cooker in 30 minutes. Didn't have the celery or green beans. Used my own homemade vegetable broth. Used diced tomatoes as that was what I had on hand. Will make again.
Great soup. I substituted kale, cavatappi pasta and fresh turmeric and spices (rosemary, thyme and such).

It was the best chicken noodle soup. On one occasion I used some fresh spinach. It made it seem more like spinach soup. From now one kind, only frozen and drained. It adds just a little flavor to this fantastic soup.this has memorial my potluck contribution for a long time, everyone loves it

this is my go-to for pot lucks as well as easy cold weather supper. It is great as-is, but over the years I've made some adjustments that make this OUTSTANDING. My changes: seasoned tomatoes, mushroom broth instead of veggie broth, the ENTIRE bunch of fresh parsley, cannellini beans, already chopped onion and celery, bagged sliced carrots, two parsnips sliced as thin as the carrots, fennel bulb sliced thin, and chopped up leaves. Double the thyme. I never put the pasta in, I keep it on the side because so many people can't have gluten, plus it sucks all the liquid up. I also use Saffron Pasta, and it makes this even better. I almost always forget to add the spinach. When I'm out, I use kale or Swiss chard.
Loved it- I added a yellow squash to the vegetable list and a small can of tomato paste when I added the macaroni and spinach - Wow it was awesome and low calorie !
This is a family favorite! For extra protein, I add two cans of kidney beans. Instead of macaroni, we enjoy it with a slice of whole wheat garlic bread.
It's good, it's filling & it's easy to make. But it's missing something.

Great basic recipe for crockpot! I followed suggestions here to saute the onion and garlic to start, subbing with chicken broth ( sorry, it was all I had on hand), and adding pasta to each serving ...is my go to crockpot recipe....until I got an Instappt, that is. :)
I needed to add a lot of salt to make it taste more appealing but I also was making soup for a crowd of 15.

The recipe is AWESOME! I have a three-4 quart slow cooker setup so I had to down size on the portions ingredients and directions however are EXCELLENT! 

I am a single man so I food preservation and storage while maintain quality are huge. I would recommend to anyone planning on not eating this immediately to cook the macaroni and spinach right before you intend to eat, this will give you that first day feeling.

I didn't do this the first time and my soup had turned into excellent baby food by the next day! I HATE WASTING FOOD! So i processed the soup and it is excellent nourishment for an infant.
awesome recipe, it stands a alone as a meal with crusty Italian bread! Parmesan is a nice touch, adds so much good flavor!
Due to cheese allergies I left off the Parmesan Cheese.
Good, made as directed except I only used 5 cups of broth (that's all I had). The kids liked it too. It was plenty of soup to feed 4-6 people (with salad side dish).
Everyone loved it. Used frozen spinach instead of fresh. Used a can of white beans in tomato sauce because that's what we had.
very good!!!
Great recipe and one could add other vegetables if they want to be creative.
I made this about a month ago and my family loved it. I added a few dashes of Tabasco to my own bowl just for a little kick. Can't go wrong with Tabasco.

Absolutely delicious!!!! A great fresh food delicious nutritional soup. I omitted the garlic because it disagrees with me. I also omitted the thyme because I didn’t have any. All else was made exactly as written. It was without a doubt the best vegetable and nutritional soup I have ever had. Thank you so much for sharing your recipe.

Made it. 
Added some red pepper flakes.
Served it with hard crusted warm bread.
Delicious.
I would describe this as “meh” at best. The spice mix was strange, overall soup had a vinegary flavor for some reason. I won’t be making this again.
Delicious! Did not change anything except the timing as everyone's crockpot cooks at a different temperature. Thawed and drained frozen spinach as suggested. Thank you for a wonderful recipe!

LOVE IT!!!! I kicked up a little. I added a can of roasted tomatoes, and extra zucchini. I put the spinach in too soon (my bad). Yet it turned out so good that I was asked if I bought it from a restaurant. ????????. Oh, and I cooked it for way more than the suggested time. I hope y’all’s soup turned out as good as mine. Best part, no heartburn afterwards. That’s a major YAY!!!!
I found this as having little flavor.
Very flavorful and definitely a keeper! My sister, who is more into meat than veggies, said this was definitely a keeper and one that she would eat again!
Excellent flavor...my vegan kids loved it! Even the meat eaters were happy!
Family loved it! Wonderful fresh taste to the vegetables. I would not change a thing. No leftovers to speak of!

Excellent! Only thing i did WRONG was to add the elbow macaroni at the very beginning, so by the time the soup was done, the macaroni was pretty much DISSOLVED! No matter tho, tasted GREAT! Froze a batch for next time!
Very good and very easy. Only changes, added more garlic and cooked pamesan cheese rind in it, then at end of cooking time diced it and added it back to soup (instead of using grated cheese).
Really enjoyed it. Will make it again, again and again.
not enough tomato base, added stewed italian tomatoes, broth got soaked up by the pasta
I made it in the Dutch oven! Tastes good -wonder if a Parmesan rind added would enhance flavor? Thanks for the inspiration
Added mushrooms and it was out of this world
No changes but will make it often. Full-flavored, delicious and filling. Tops my soup list now.
Loved it! Great flavor and healthy! I added 1/2 t cayenne pepper and an additional t of black pepper.

I made this to take to a work night social gathering and it was a big hit. I added two cans of beans, one kidney and one cannelloni and used two cans of diced tomatoes rather than crushed. It was delicious and the leftovers were great for lunch.
Good as is!
Loved it and will make it again.
I loved this soup! I cooked it in a large pot on the stove. I added the cooked pasta last and for an addition, I added 1/2 pound of cooked ground beef. It tasted like the soup at Olive Garden!
full of flavor
I sure will have to make this again.
Great recipe! I added a can of garbanzo beans and doubled the zucchini count. A definite 'make-again'!
I love it! Really good..I made this for my lunches for the week.

I have been making a variation of this for years. For my version I use chicken broth instead of veggie broth, Rotel instead of plain tomatoes for some kick, I also use white kidney beans as well as the dark red and chick peas. otherwise its the same deliciousness.
Have made several times and I love it. I usually add more veggies but no other changes.

Will definitely make this again.

I swapped the celery for two sliced rashers of bacon and a leek, used 200g of pasta which was slightly over cooked and did not soak up the broth contrary to other comments I read. I added a jar of the cheapest tomato pasta sauce I could buy and will make with only 1 L of water next time for a slightly thicker soup.
Excellent dish
Delicious and freezes well.
I found that 6 hours on low wasn't quite long enough, and next time, I'd definitely sautee the onions a little first.

Thought it came out perfectly delicious. Would have used another can of Kidney beans (personal preference), but everyone enjoyed it. Kept the noodle separate and combined them i each bowl, which I think helped keep the consistency on point. Also, directions weren't as clear as they could be but nothing too difficult to figure out.
Flavors mixed perfectly the soup lasted for days and got better everyday
Too tomatoey and onions were crunchy, almost raw, and that was after letting it cook longer than recipe said to.
My wife and daughter loved it
It was easy and delicious!
I make this every year it is so nice sometimes I put a couple of ham hocks in which is just as yummy.
It was delicious. I made it in a Dutch oven and sautésd the onions and some of the other veggies first. I thought I th would give it more flavor. And it did.
Delicious just as written!
We loved it so much that I made it again tonight, when I initially tried it on Saturday night. I took some to work and it was a hit!
I've had much better. the recipe yields a lot but the flavors are pretty mellow. I've definitely had better minestrone.
Great soup! So easy to make! One of those recipes where you can just use what you have on hand and it still won't go wrong. Inexpensive! Healthy! Will be staple in my household for sure!
Fantastic soup.
Excellent flavor

Very good recipe. Tasty soup and really easy to put together. I cooked the vegetables a bit because I was short on time and was worried that it wouldn’t be done on time. I used frozen spinach as that was what was available. I also couldn’t find cannelini beans so I used 2 cans of navy beans. Also used small shells couldn’t find ditali pasta so next time I find ditali I’ll stock pile just for this soup. It made a large slowcooker full before the pasta and I will definitely make it again.

I did make a few changes. I substituted a couple of things with what I had in hand. I did not have kidney beans so I ommited them. I used canned zucchini because I did not have fresh. Instead of elbow macaroni I used rotini. I know these are a lot of changes but I don't think it affected the flavor. I loved the balance of flavors. I would like to make this again.
This was delicious! I used beef broth and added Italian sausage. Big hit!

Decent basic recipe. I actually used chicken broth instead of veggie and I used a lot more of it than recipe called for. I used basically the same ingredients but just eyeballed everything to my taste. I did sautee the garlic and onions in olive oil first. First day I made it, I was just okay. But I stuck it in fridge and found the flavor greatly increased over a couple days and I really liked it by day 2. I will, in the future make it a couple days before I plan to serve it. It was a big hit with the family. We ate every bit of it and usually end up tossing the last of most soups I make cause everybody gets tired of it. Not this one. Ate it all.

Just made this soup yesterday. I had everything except the zucchini,just added more to some veg. It was delicious, did not change a thing. Cooked first on high for the first hour than slow for the next 5 hours. I have a lot of left overs, will be definitely making this again.
